channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: politics
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: politics

item.title: Mamdani’s God Squad: The clerics, activists and political operatives who have his back
item.description: New York mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani receives backing from over 110 political groups and Muslim organizations amid allegations of Islamophobia against critics.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Food stamp benefits for 42 million Americans in jeopardy today amid shutdown
item.description: President Donald Trump could use $5 billion emergency fund for SNAP benefits during shutdown, Democrats argue, while Republicans demand government reopening first.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Tanzanian President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan has won a disputed election with over 97% of the vote, according to official results announced on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: From the subway to social media, NYC mayoral candidates make their closing arguments to voters
item.description: The final stretch of New York City's mayoral race has candidates Zohran Mamdani and Andrew Cuomo painting two very different pictures.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Izaguirre, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Illinois lawmakers pass bill banning ICE immigration arrests near courthouses
item.description: Illinois lawmakers passed a bill blocking federal immigration arrests near courthouses and allowing civil lawsuits for constitutional rights violations.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: VP JD Vance dresses up as his own viral meme for Halloween, social media post tops 15 million views
item.description: JD Vance's Halloween meme video goes viral with 13 million views as vice president embraces the trolls, turning online ridicule into social media gold.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President NicolÃ¡s Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump signals he'll fund SNAP
item.description: President Trump indicated Friday he would fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) if given "the appropriate legal direction" after a federal judge ordered officials to spend an emergency fund for the program.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Republican leaders reject Trump's demands to scrap the Senate filibuster to end the shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) â Back from a week abroad, President Donald Trump threw himself into the shutdown debate, calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster and reopen the government, an idea swiftly rejected Friday by Republican leaders who have long opposed such a move.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Judges order Trump administration to use emergency reserves for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: BOSTON (AP) â Two federal judges ruled nearly simultaneously on Friday that President Donald Trumpâs administration must continue to pay for SNAP, the nationâs biggest food aid program, using emergency reserve funds during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL CASEY, GEOFF MULVIHILL and KIMBERLEE KRUESI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump reveals first photos after Lincoln Bedroom's renovation in the White House
item.description: President shares before-and-after photos of renovated Lincoln Bedroom bathroom on Truth Social, featuring polished statuary marble and gold fixtures.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: New Pentagon policy undercuts trans troops' ability to ask to stay in the military, AP learns
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) â The Pentagon has rolled out a new policy that will severely undercut the ability for transgender troops who have been banned from the armed forces by the Trump administration to turn to boards of their peers to argue for their right to stay in the military, according to a memo obta
item.dc:creator: KONSTANTIN TOROPIN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Civil war erupts on the right after Heritage president's Tucker Carlson, Nick Fuentes comments
item.description: A civil war over the direction of the conservative movement and who should be considered part of it erupted after Heritage Foundation President Kevin Roberts posted a video Thursday defending Tucker Carlson for interviewing white nationalist Nick Fuentes.
item.dc:creator: Emily Brooks, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: This is why Nevada didn't make a move on daylight saving time this year
item.description: LAS VEGAS (KLAS) â Six months ago, the Nevada Legislature was poised to pass an end to daylight saving time. What happened? A Reno Democrat, Assemblywoman Selena La Rue Hatch, sponsored Assembly Bill 81, and it appeared to have momentum.
item.dc:creator: Greg Haas, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: South African government criticizes Trump's refugee policy prioritizing white Afrikaner minority
item.description: JOHANNESBURG (AP) â South Africa's government on Friday criticized the U.S. refugee policy shift that gives priority to Afrikaners, the country's white minority group of Dutch descent.
item.dc:creator: MOGOMOTSI MAGOME, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Government shutdown offers schools a glimpse of life without an Education Department
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) â The government shutdown has been a source of anxiety for school leaders wondering how long grant money will last and who can help them interpret federal laws. For Education Secretary Linda McMahon, it offers a preview of what she hopes to make permanent.
item.dc:creator: COLLIN BINKLEY and MAKIYA SEMINERA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump calls on Republicans to use 'nuclear option' and get rid of Senate filibuster
item.description: President Trump called on Senate Republicans on Thursday to initiate the "nuclear option" and get rid of the filibuster, which would allow them to end the government shutdown and pass legislation with a simple majority.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: Florida Dems urge Gov. DeSantis to act as SNAP benefits risk halt
item.description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (WFLA) â Millions of Floridians who rely on federal food assistance could be left hanging as soon as this weekend as the government shutdown continues now on day 30.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie LaPorte, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Border Patrol's Bovino to 'go harder' after Chicago judge's order
item.description: Gregory Bovino welcomes a judge's order to use a body camera, which he says will tell a story of federal operations.
item.dc:creator: Ali Bradley, NewsNation

item.title: 5 deals Trump, Xi struck in South Korea
item.description: President Trump emerged from his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday touting agreements on tariffs, rare earth exports and soybean purchases as the two superpowers reached truces on key issues.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: How to find food if your SNAP benefits are cut off
item.description: Unless something changes dramatically in the next couple days, more than 40 million Americans are preparing to have federal food assistance cut off starting Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, NewsNation

item.title: TSA agents hit with financial stress amid shutdo
item.description: TSA workers across the state of Minnesota are faced with not only securing passengers but also securing their next meal.
item.dc:creator: Cathy Wurzer, Lukas Levin, and Gracie Stockton, MPR News

item.title: Trump keeps flirting with the idea of a third term. That would be unconstitutional
item.description: A recent interview with Steve Bannon reignited chatter about whether President Trump would try to run in 2028, despite the 22nd Amendment.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith, MPR News

item.title: PIX11 Poll: Mamdani holds commanding lead in NYC mayor's race with voting underway
item.description: NEW YORK CITY (PIX11) â Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City Zohran Mamdani holds a 25-point lead in the race with just days left until Election Day, according to new exclusive polling from PIX11, Emerson College Polling, and The Hill.
item.dc:creator: Henry Rosoff, PIX 11

item.title: PIX11 Poll: New Jersey governor's race as tight as it gets
item.description: NEW JERSEY (PIX11) â Democrat Mikie Sherrill holds a 1% lead over Republican Jack Ciattarelli in the race for New Jersey governor, according to new exclusive polling from PIX11, Emerson College Polling, and The Hill. The poll shows Sherrill at 49.3% and Ciattarelli at 47.9%.
item.dc:creator: Henry Rosoff, PIX 11

item.title: Día de los Muertos vigil remembers those who died in ICE custody
item.description: Marigolds, candles andÂ traditional offerings were set on an ofrenda, also known as an altar, at the Otay Mesa Detention Center on Wednesday to remember people who died while in detention facilities across the country.
item.dc:creator: Chris Ponce, Fox 5

item.title: Fed cuts interest rates again amid job market concerns
item.description: The Federal Reserve cut its benchmark interest rate by a quarter percentage point Wednesday, because the central bank is more concerned about the job market than it is with battling inflation.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley, MPR News

item.title: White House fires federal design commission
item.description: The White House has fired all six members of the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts, the independent federal agency that reviews design plans for monuments, memorials, coins and federal buildings.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair, MPR News

item.title: How a bike trip helped bridge a political divide
item.description: A handful of Minnesota legislators from opposite sides of the aisle are pairing up to learn more about each other's districts. This comes at a time of deep political polarization and just months after the politically motivated assassination of former House Speaker Melissa Hortman.
item.dc:creator: Catharine Richert, MPR News

item.title: Some Minnesota residents face tax bumps all around
item.description: As local governments face increased costs and more directives from state and federal laws, added costs are expected to drive up taxes for property owners. In some places, the tax hits are coming from all directions.
item.dc:creator: Peter Cox, MPR News

item.title: Minnesota Senate control hangs on special elections
item.description: Contests in Woodbury and Wright County will restore the Senate to its full complement next week. The result could flip control of the chamber, and campaign messaging could carry through to 2026 when all 201 legislative seats are on the ballot.
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson, MPR News

item.title: Understanding the 2025 government shutdown: Causes, impact and what's next
item.description: MPR News guest host Catharine Richert talks with a political scientist about the federal government shutdown â how we got here, how the shutdown is affecting people and what it reveals about the balance of power in Washington.
item.dc:creator: Catharine Richert and Cari Dwyer, MPR News

item.title: Debate of health care subsidies continues
item.description: As the federal government shutdown drags on with no end in sight, the debate over whether to extend federal health insurance subsidies continues to play a central role in the impasse â including in Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Grace Praxmarer and The Associated Press, MPR News

item.title: The Latest: Trump meets with Japan’s newly elected, first female leader, Sanae Takaichi
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump is meeting with Japan's newly elected, ultraconservative leader in Tokyo during one of the busiest days of his Asia trip, the itinerary of which includes speaking to U.S. troops aboard an aircraft carrier and mingling with business leaders.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Hakeem Jeffries pushes for Illinois congressional map redraw to aid Democrats amid Chicago visit
item.description: Republicans have been quick to criticize Illinois Governor JB Pritzker over Illinois' current congressional map.
item.dc:creator: Mike Lowe, WGN 9

item.title: Melania Trump privately raised concerns about tearing down East Wing: Report
item.description: First lady Melania Trump privately raised concerns about demolishing the East Wing for President Donald Trump's new ballroom, according to The Wall Street Journal.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Cook County candidates file nominating petitions for March primary election
item.description: Monday is the first day for Cook County political candidates to file nominating petitions for the March primary election.
item.dc:creator: Michael Johnson, WGN 9
